transportAdvice: Athens has a reliable metro system, along with buses and trams, that connects major tourist areas including the Acropolis, Syntagma Square, and Piraeus port. The historic centre is largely walkable, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy, with mild temperatures that make sightseeing comfortable but require a jacket.
Similar to January with slightly improving conditions, though rain showers remain common.
Spring begins to emerge with warmer days, though some rain and cool evenings persist.
Pleasant spring weather with mild temperatures and mostly sunny skies, ideal for outdoor exploration.
Warm and sunny with very little rain, making it one of the best months to visit Athens.
Hot and dry with long sunny days and virtually no rainfall, perfect for sightseeing in the early morning.
Peak summer heat with intense midday sun; early morning or evening visits to outdoor sites are strongly recommended.
Equally hot as July with dry conditions; the city can feel very busy and the heat is significant during midday.
Temperatures begin to ease slightly, with warm sunny days and a more comfortable atmosphere than peak summer.
Mild and pleasant with occasional rain returning, offering a good balance of warmth and manageable crowds.
Noticeably cooler with more frequent rain, though outdoor sightseeing remains feasible with appropriate clothing.
Cool and wet with short days, but the city has a festive atmosphere and major sites are far less crowded.
